intro: Palicourea fissistipula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale green, and it produces small, woody fruits. Palicourea fissistipula is often found in shaded, humid environments such as forests and undergrowth.
